meanings.definition: having a dowdy or unfashionable appearance
meanings.sent1: She wore a frumpier dress to the party than usual.
meanings.sent2: The old sweater looked even frumpier after being washed multiple times.
meanings.sent3: Despite her efforts, she always ended up looking frumpier than her stylish friends.
meanings.sent4: The outdated curtains made the entire room feel frumpier.
meanings.sent5: The frumpier outfit made her blend into the background.

meanings.definition: in a dowdy or unfashionable manner
meanings.sent1: She dressed frumpier than usual for the event.
meanings.sent2: The old man walked frumpier than the rest of the group.
meanings.sent3: Even with the fancy accessories, she still managed to look frumpier.
meanings.sent4: The music played frumpier as the night went on.
meanings.sent5: The house was decorated frumpier than expected.

meanings.definition: a person who is dowdy or unfashionable
meanings.sent1: She was considered the frumpier of the two sisters.
meanings.sent2: The frumpier in the office always wore outdated clothes.
meanings.sent3: The fashion show had a surprise guest appearance by a frumpier.
meanings.sent4: He felt like a frumpier among the stylish crowd.
meanings.sent5: The movie portrayed the villain as a frumpier character.
